translated: The story of the questions of Shiva, Skanda, and Ribhu, and the replies, which will be mentioned later, is for the praise of knowledge. Here, at the beginning, in the first chapter, without the arrangement of questions and answers, the Shruti itself teaches the truth of Brahman without distinctions, which is accomplished by the means of the fifteen-limbed yoga, to those who are qualified as stated, with the words Tejobindu. For those sages who desire to contemplate on the nature of their own Self, for those sages who have a mind for the meditation on Brahman without distinctions, for those wise ones also, I will speak of that supreme meditation which has as its object the form of the Tejobindu, which is the mere Self without any counter-correlate, and which is accomplished by the denial of the darkness of ignorance and its effects other than one's own Self. What is the object of meditation? To this he says Vishva etc. He who has as his body the entire universe, which is trusted by one's own ignorant self as existing separately, is this Vishvatma, the Virata. In the lotus of his heart, in the midst of the thousand petals, is the Tejobindu, which is the mere Self without any counter-correlate, and which is accomplished by the denial of the darkness of ignorance and its effects other than one's own Self.

translated: They who have taken refuge in the variegated Brahman, who are followers of their own knowledge, know that the waking state is in the eye. In the face established by the Vedic text The universe is in the right eye, the waking state, etc. have three forms each, as the locus of the unity of the individual, the universal, and both, in the distinctions of the universe, the universe, etc., the Viraj, the Viraj, etc., the Yoni, the Yoni, etc. By the word ca (and), the forms of each of those four are also included. They find, they know, by their own non-difference. Thus, he who has three abodes is called the three-abode Gander. The Gander is the Supreme Lord, who destroys his own self by his own knowledge. He, being free from sloth, being free from dependence on others, having become independent, that which is said to be identified with Him, being the locus of all negations, is beyond the conception of the waking state, etc. Being inexpressible to one who is not qualified, it is the secret Brahman, the supernal abode that depends on the abode to be supernally abided in.

translated: That very Brahman, due to the view of one's own ignorance etc., seems to have particularities, to have the absence of particularities in relation to that, and to have the absence of alternatives without any other side, when seen in the ultimate sense. translated: Nor is there any existence, real or unreal, of the perishable or the imperishable.

original: guṇaṃ vā viguṇaṃ vāpi sa ma ātmā na saṃśayaḥ /
analyzed: guṇam vā viguṇam vā api sa me ātmā na saṃśayaḥ
translated: He who has no virtue or vice, he is my Self, there is no doubt.

analyzed: yasya vācyam vācakam vā śrāvaṇam mananam ca vā
translated: For him who has nothing to be expressed or an expresser, nothing to be heard or thought,

analyzed: draṣṭṛ darśana dṛśyam vā īṣat mātram kalā ātmakam
translated: Nor any seer, seeing, or object seen, even in the slightest, consisting of parts,

analyzed: kumāreṇa sākam ṛbhuḥ nāma brahma mānasa putraḥ saḥ api śiva mukhataḥ akhaṇḍa eka rasa cit mātra jñāna tad anubhava tad āntarālika mukhya phala ātmaka jīvanmukti videha muktyoḥ iyattām avagamya kṛtakṛtya padam gataḥ khalu tam kadācid nidāghaḥ nāma muniḥ samasta veda śāstra purāṇa itihāsa ādiṣu ātma anātmānau staḥ iti śrūyate tayoḥ iyattā jijñāsayā pṛṣṭavān iti āha śrutiḥ nidāghaḥ iti tad praśnam aṅgīkṛtya
translated: Along with the prince, a son of Brahmā named Ṛbhu, he too, having understood the extent of the liberation of the living self and the liberation of the embodied self, which are the main fruits of the knowledge of the undivided, single, pure consciousness, its experience, and the interval between them, from Śiva's mouth, has indeed attained the state of having done his duty. Once, a sage named Nidāgha, having heard that the self and the non-self exist in all the Vedas, scriptures, Purāṇas, Itihāsas, etc., asked him about their extent out of a desire to know it. The Śruti says: Nidāgha. Having accepted his question,

original: p / sa hovāca / kiṃ tat ityatra sarvavāca iti / sarvavāco'vadhiḥ aśabdatvāt / sarvacintāvadhiḥ pratīcaścintādivṛttigrāsatvāt / svājñādidṛṣṭyā sarvakāraṇakāryātmā // // sarvanādamayaḥ nādatajjavedaśāstrasiddhāntārthatvāt / svājñasamarpitasarvavarjitacinmātraḥ // // svānubhūtidhyānādiviṣayasya saviśeṣatā syādityata āha sarveti // // tattvaṃpadavākyārtha ātmetyata āha mahāvākyeti // // kṣarākṣaravihīnaḥ kṣarākṣarakalanāviralaparamākṣaratvāt // // paramātmano vyāviddhanānāpadavākyārthatvena mahāvākyātmasaccidānandaśabdatadvācyārthavarjitatvāt sa nirdeṣṭumiti / karmakāṇḍagocaravedavākyaiḥ sākṣādagamyatāṃ gacchatīti agamyagaḥ // //
analyzed: sa ha uvāca kim tat iti atra sarva vācaḥ iti sarva vācaḥ avadhiḥ aśabda tvāt sarva cintā avadhiḥ pratīcaḥ cintā ādi vṛtti grāsa tvāt sva ājña ādi dṛṣṭyā sarva kāraṇa kārya ātmā      sarva nāda mayaḥ nāda tad ja veda śāstra siddhānta artha tvāt sva ājña samarpita sarva varjita cit mātraḥ  / sva anubhūti dhyāna ādi viṣayasya sa viśeṣa tā syāt iti atas āha sarva iti     tattvam pada vākya arthaḥ ātmā iti atas āha mahāvākya iti    kṣara a
translated: He said: What is that? Here, all words are the limit of all words because of being soundless. The limit of all thought is the western direction because of swallowing the activity of thought etc. It is the self of all causes and effects by the view of one's own ignorance etc. It is the essence of all sound because of being the meaning of the Vedanta scriptures born from sound. It is mere consciousness devoid of all that is offered by one's own ignorance. It is said to be the object of one's own experience, meditation etc. to have particularity. Therefore, it is said to be all etc. The meaning of the sentence that thou art is the Self. Therefore, it is said to be the great sentence etc. It is devoid of the perishable and the imperishable because of being the supreme syllable devoid of the proliferation of the perishable and the imperishable. Of the supreme Self, by the meaning of the various sentences scattered about, it is devoid of the words existence, consciousness, bliss and their denotations. Therefore, it is to be indicated. It goes to a state of being directly unknowable by the Vedic sentences of the Karma Kanda. Therefore, it is the agamyaga.

analyzed: anātmanaḥ sarvasya mithyātvam
translated: The falsity of all that is not the Self

original: anātmeti prasaṅgo vā anātmeti mano'pi vā // //
analyzed: anātmā iti prasaṅgaḥ vā anātmā iti vā
translated: Or the idea of non-self may arise, or the mind may think of non-self.

analyzed: anātmā iti jagat vā api na asti anātmā iti niścinu
translated: Or the world may be non-self. Conclude that there is no non-self.

analyzed: sarva saṃkalpa śūnya tvāt sarva kārya vivarjanāt
translated: Because of the absence of all conceptualization, because of the avoidance of all actions,

analyzed: kevalam brahma mātra tvāt na asti anātmā iti niścinu  deha traya vihīna tvāt kāla traya vivarjanāt
translated: because of being only Brahman alone, conclude that there is no non-self.🔽Because of the absence of the three bodies, because of the avoidance of the three times,

analyzed: jīva traya guṇa abhāvāt tāpa traya vivarjanāt
translated: because of the absence of the qualities of the three lives, because of the avoidance of the three kinds of distress,

analyzed: loka traya vihīna tvāt sarvam ātmā iti śāsanāt
translated: because of the absence of the three worlds, because of the teaching that everything is the Self,

analyzed: citta abhāvāt cintanīyam deha abhāvāt jarā na ca
translated: because of the absence of mind, what is to be thought cannot exist; because of the absence of the body, old age does not exist.

analyzed: pāda abhāvāt gatiḥ nā asti hasta abhāvāt kriyā na ca
translated: Because of the absence of feet, there is no movement; because of the absence of hands, there is no action.

analyzed: mṛtyuḥ nā asti jana abhāvāt buddhi abhāvāt sukha ādikam
translated: Because of the absence of people, there is no death; because of the absence of intellect, there is no happiness, etc.

original: dharmo nāsti śucirnāsti satyaṃ nāsti bhayaṃ na ca // //
analyzed: dharmaḥ na asti śuciḥ na asti satyam na asti bhayam na ca
translated: There is no dharma, there is no purity, there is no truth, there is no fear.

analyzed: akṣara uccāraṇam na asti guru śiṣya ādi na asti api
translated: There is no utterance of the syllable Om, there is no teacher, no disciple, etc.

original: ekābhāve dvitīyaṃ na na dvitīye na caikatā // //
analyzed: eka abhāve dvitīyam na na dvitīye na ca eka tā
translated: In the absence of one, the second does not exist; in the absence of the second, there is no oneness.

original: satyatvamasti cet kiṃcidasattvaṃ na ca saṃbhavet /
analyzed: satya tvam asti ced kiṃcid asattvam na ca saṃbhavet
translated: If there is anything that exists truly, non-existence cannot be possible.

analyzed: asatya tvam yadi bhavet satya tvam na ghaṭiṣyati
translated: If it were non-existent, existence would not be possible.

analyzed: śubham yadi aśubham viddhi aśubhāt śubham iṣyate
translated: If you consider good to be bad, and bad to be good,

analyzed: bhayam yadi abhayam viddhi hi abhayāt bhayam āpatet
translated: If you consider fear to be fearless, and fearlessness to be fear,

analyzed: bandha tvam asti ced mokṣaḥ bandha abhāve kva mokṣa tā
translated: If there is bondage, there is liberation; in the absence of bondage, where is liberation?

original: maraṇaṃ yadi cejjanma janmābhāve mṛtirna ca // //
analyzed: maraṇam yadi ced janma janma abhāve mṛtiḥ na ca
translated: If there is death, there is birth; in the absence of birth, there is no death.

original: tvamityapi bhaveccāhaṃ tvaṃ no cedahameva na /🔽idaṃ yadi tadevāsti tadabhāvādidaṃ na ca // //
analyzed: tvam iti api bhavet ca aham tvam no ced aham eva na  idam yadi tat eva asti tad abhāvāt idam na ca
translated: You may also be I; if you are not, then I myself am not.🔽If this exists, that exists; if that does not exist, this does not exist.

original: astīti cennāsti tadā nāsti cedasti kiṃcana /
analyzed: asti iti ced na asti tadā na asti ced asti kiṃcana
translated: If it exists, it does not exist; if it does not exist, it exists.

analyzed: kāryam ced kāraṇam kiṃcid kārya abhāve na kāraṇam
translated: If there is an effect, there is a cause; in the absence of an effect, there is no cause.

analyzed: dvaitam yadi tadā advaitam dvaita abhāve dvayam na ca
translated: If there is duality, there is non-duality; in the absence of duality, there is no non-duality.

original: dṛśyaṃ yadi dṛgapyasti dṛśyābhāve dṛgeva na // //
analyzed: dṛśyam yadi dṛś api asti dṛśya abhāve dṛś eva na
translated: If there is an object of vision, there is also a seer; in the absence of an object of vision, there is no seer.

analyzed: antar yadi bahis satyam anta abhāve bahis na ca
translated: If there is inside, there is outside; in the absence of inside, there is no outside.

analyzed: pūrṇa tvam asti ced kiṃcid apūrṇa tvam prasajyate
translated: If there is some completeness, incompleteness is implied.

original: tasmādetat kvacinnāsti tvaṃ cāhaṃ vā ime idam /
analyzed: tasmāt etat kvacid na asti tvam ca aham vai ime idam
translated: Therefore, this does not exist anywhere - you, I, these, this.

analyzed: na asti dṛṣṭāntikam satye na asti dārṣṭāntikam hi aje
translated: There is no example in truth, there is no illustrated in the unborn.

original: p / paraṃ brahmāhamasmīti smaraṇasya mano na hi /

translated: The mind is not of the remembrance I am the supreme Brahman.

analyzed: brahma mātram jagat idam brahma mātram tvam api aham
translated: This world is Brahman alone, you are also I.

analyzed: cit mātram kevalam ca aham na asti anātmā iti niścinu
translated: I am only pure consciousness. There is no non-self. Be certain of this.

original: idaṃ prapañcaṃ nāstyeva notpannaṃ no sthitaṃ kvacit // //
analyzed: idam na asti eva na utpannam no sthitam kvacid
translated: This world does not exist at all. It is neither produced nor does it exist anywhere.

analyzed: cittam prapañcam iti āhuḥ na asti na asti eva sarvadā
translated: They say the mind is the world. It never exists at all.

original: na prapañcaṃ na cittādi nāhaṃkāro na jīvakaḥ // //
analyzed: na prapañcam na citta ādi na ahaṃkāraḥ na jīvakaḥ
translated: There is no world, no mind, no ego, no individual soul.

original: māyākāryādikaṃ nāsti māyā nāsti bhayaṃ na hi /
analyzed: māyā kārya ādikam nā asti māyā nā asti bhayam na hi
translated: The products of illusion do not exist. There is no illusion, no fear.

analyzed: kartā na asti kriyā na asti śravaṇam mananam na hi
translated: There is no doer, no action, no hearing, no reflection.

analyzed: samādhi dvitayam nā asti mātṛmān ādi nā asti hi
translated: There are no two kinds of meditation, no mother, no measurement, and so on.

analyzed: ajñānam ca api na asti eva hi avivekam kadācana
translated: Ignorance also does not exist at all. There is never any lack of discrimination.

analyzed: anubandha catuṣkam na saṃbandha trayam eva na  na gaṅgā na gayā setuḥ na bhūtam na anyat asti hi
translated: The four kinds of connection do not exist, nor do the three kinds of relation.🔽There is no Ganges, no Gayā, no bridge, no past, and nothing else.

original: na bhūmirna jalaṃ nāgnirna vāyurna ca khaṃ kvacit /
analyzed: na bhūmiḥ na jalam na agniḥ na vāyuḥ na ca kham kvacid
translated: There is no earth, no water, no fire, no air, no space anywhere.

original: na devā na ca dikpālā na vedā na guruḥ kvacit // //
analyzed: na devāḥ na ca dikpālāḥ na vedāḥ na guruḥ kvacid
translated: Neither gods, nor guardians of the directions, nor the Vedas, nor the teacher anywhere,

analyzed: na dūram na antikam na alam na madhyam na kvacid sthitam

analyzed: na advaitam dvaita satyam vā hi asatyam vai idam na ca
translated: Not non-duality, not duality as true, nor is this false,

analyzed: bandha mokṣa ādikam na asti sat vā asat vā sukha ādi vā
translated: There is no bondage, liberation, etc., nor existence or non-existence, nor happiness, etc.

original: jātirnāsti gatirnāsti varṇo nāsti ca laukikam // //
analyzed: jātiḥ na asti gatiḥ na asti varṇaḥ na asti ca laukikam
translated: There is no caste, no rebirth, no social class, and no worldly life,

translated: Everything is Brahman - this is not, and even Brahman itself does not exist.

analyzed: cit iti eva iti na asti eva cit ahaṃbhāṣaṇam na hi
translated: The word cit (consciousness) does not exist, and the statement I am consciousness is not true.

original: p / ahaṃ brahmāsmi nāstyeva nityaśuddho'smi na kvacit /
analyzed: aham brahma asmi na asti eva nitya śuddhaḥ asmi na kvacid
translated: I am Brahman - this is not, and I am eternally pure - this is not anywhere.

analyzed: vācā yat ucyate kiṃcid manasā manute kvacid
translated: Whatever is said by speech, whatever is thought by the mind,

original: buddhyā niścinute nāsti cittena jñāyate na hi /
analyzed: buddhyā niścinute na asti cittena jñāyate na hi
translated: Whatever is ascertained by the intellect, is not, and is not known by the mind.

analyzed: yogi yoga ādikam na asti sadā sarvam sadā na ca

analyzed: ahar rātra ādikam nā asti snāna dhyāna ādikam na hi
translated: Day and night, etc. do not exist, and bathing, meditation, etc. are not.

analyzed: bhrāntiḥ abhrānti na asti eva na asti anātmā iti niścinu
translated: Delusion and non-delusion do not exist. Be certain that there is no non-self.

original: vedaṃ śāstraṃ purāṇaṃ ca kāryaṃ kāraṇamīśvaraḥ /
analyzed: vedam śāstram purāṇam ca kāryam kāraṇam īśvaraḥ
translated: The Vedas, scriptures, and Puranas, action, cause, and God,

analyzed: lokaḥ bhūtam janaḥ tu aikyam sarvam mithyā na saṃśayaḥ
translated: The world, the people, the unity, everything is false, there is no doubt.

analyzed: gauṇam mukhyam param ca anyat sarvam mithyā na saṃśayaḥ

analyzed: śrotrābhyām śrūyate yat yat anyat sadbhāvam eva ca

All superimposition, all secrecy, all distinctions in enjoyment,

analyzed: sarva doṣa prabhedāḥ ca na asti anātmā iti niścinu

translated: Mine and thine, mine and thine, and so on - all that would be false.

translated: The existence of the internal organ, and the possibility of ignorance,

analyzed: aneka koṭi brahmāṇḍam sarvam mithyā iti niścinu
translated: The many koṭis of Brahmandas - all this is false - be certain of this.

analyzed: yena kena api gaditam yena kena api moditam

analyzed: yatra yatra śubham karma yatra yatra ca duṣkṛtam
translated: Wherever there is good karma, and wherever there is evil,

analyzed: dehā ūham iti yā buddhiḥ tṛṣṇā doṣa āmayaḥ kila
translated: The notion that I am the body is thirst, and the disease of faults, indeed.

analyzed: yat kiṃcid api saṃkalpam tāpa trayam iti īritam
translated: Any kind of conceptualization is called the triad of torments.

original: kāmaṃ krodhaṃ bandhanaṃ sarvaduḥkhaṃ viśvaṃ doṣaṃ kālanānāsvarūpam /
analyzed: kāmam krodham bandhanam sarva duḥkham viśvam doṣam kāla nānā svarūpam
translated: Desire, anger, bondage, all suffering, the entire world, faults, the various forms of time,

original: yatkiṃcedaṃ sarvasaṃkalpajālaṃ tatkiṃcedaṃ mānasaṃ somya viddhi // //
analyzed: yat kiṃca idam sarva saṃkalpa jālam tat kiṃca idam mānasam somya viddhi
translated: Whatever this is, this entire net of conceptualization, know that to be the mind, O dear one.

original: mana eva jagat sarvaṃ mana eva mahāripuḥ /
analyzed: manaḥ eva jagat sarvam manaḥ eva mahā ripuḥ
translated: The entire world is indeed the mind, the mind alone is the great enemy.

original: mana eva hi saṃsāro mana eva jagattrayam // //
analyzed: manaḥ eva hi saṃsāraḥ manaḥ eva jagattrayam
translated: Indeed, the mind is the transmigratory world, the mind alone is the three worlds.

original: mana eva mahadduḥkhaṃ mana eva jarādikam /
analyzed: manaḥ eva mahat duḥkham manaḥ eva jarā ādikam
translated: The mind alone is great suffering, the mind alone is old age and so on.

original: mana eva hi kālaṃ ca mana eva malaṃ tathā // //
analyzed: manaḥ eva hi kālam ca manaḥ eva malam tathā
translated: The mind alone is time, and the mind alone is impurity.

original: mana eva hi saṃkalpo mana eva hi jīvakaḥ /
analyzed: manaḥ eva hi saṃkalpaḥ manaḥ eva hi jīvakaḥ
translated: The mind alone is conceptualization, the mind alone is the living being.

original: mana eva hi cittaṃ ca mano'haṃkāra eva ca // //
analyzed: manaḥ eva hi cittam ca manaḥ ohaṃkāraḥ eva ca
translated: The mind alone is the mind, and the mind alone is the ego.

original: mana eva mahabandhaṃ mano'ntaḥkaraṇaṃ ca tat /
analyzed: manaḥ eva maha bandham manaḥ ntaḥkaraṇam ca tat
translated: The mind alone is the great bondage, and the mind alone is the internal organ.

original: mana eva hi bhūmiśca mana eva hi toyakam // //
analyzed: manaḥ eva hi bhūmiḥ ca manaḥ eva hi toyakam
translated: The mind alone is the earth, and the mind alone is the water.

original: mana eva hi tejaśca mana eva marunmahān /
analyzed: manaḥ eva hi tejaḥ ca manaḥ eva marut mahān
translated: The mind alone is the fire, and the mind alone is the great wind.

original: mana eva hi cākāśaṃ mana eva hi śabdakam // //
analyzed: manaḥ eva hi ca ākāśam manaḥ eva hi śabdakam
translated: The mind alone is the space, and the mind alone is the sound.

original: p / sparśaṃ rūpaṃ rasaṃ gandhaṃ kośāḥ pañca manobhavāḥ /
analyzed: sparśam rūpam rasam gandham kośāḥ pañca manobhavāḥ
translated: Touch, form, taste, smell - these five are the sheaths born of the mind.

analyzed: jāgrat svapna suṣupti ādi manaḥ mayam iti īritam
translated: The state of waking, dreaming, deep sleep, etc. is said to be made of mind.

analyzed: dikpālāḥ vasavaḥ rudrāḥ ādityāḥ ca manaḥ mayāḥ
translated: The guardians of the directions, the Vasus, the Rudras, and the Adityas are made of mind.

analyzed: dṛśyam jaḍam dvandva jātam ajñānam mānasam smṛtam
translated: The seen, inert, dualistic world is known as mental ignorance.

analyzed: saṃkalpam eva yat kiṃcid tat tat na asti iti niścinu
translated: Whatever is mere imagination, know that to be non-existent.

original: nāsti nāsti jagat sarvaṃ guruśiṣyādikaṃ na hi // //
analyzed: na asti na asti jagat sarvam guru śiṣya ādikam na hi
translated: The entire world does not exist, the teacher, the disciple, etc. do not exist.

analyzed: iti upaniṣad
translated: Thus ends the Upanishad.

original: svājñadṛṣṭiprasaktasvātiriktānarthanidānaṃ kim ityāśaṅkya sarvānarthahetuḥ saṃkalpa evetyāha deha iti / saṃkalpamityādi vibhaktivyatyayaḥ // // saṃkalpamūlaṃ kimityatra kāmam ityādi // // svāvidyāpadatatkāryajātaṃ mana evetyarthaḥ / ityupaniṣacchabdaḥ adhyāyaparisamāptyarthaḥ // //
analyzed: sva ajña dṛṣṭi prasakta sva atirikta anartha nidānam kim iti āśaṅkya sarva anartha hetuḥ saṃkalpaḥ eva iti āha dehaḥ iti saṃkalpam ityādi vibhakti vyatyayaḥ    saṃkalpa mūlam kim iti atra kāmam ityādi     sva avidyā pada tad kārya jātam manaḥ eva iti arthaḥ iti upaniṣad śabdaḥ adhyāya parisamāpti arthaḥ  /
translated: Fearing that the cause of all evil other than one's own self is attached to one's own ignorant vision, he says that imagination alone is the cause of all evil. The case ending is inverted in sankalpa-mūlam etc. Kama etc. is in response to what is the root of imagination? The meaning is that the state of one's own ignorance and its effects are mere mind. The word upaniṣat is for the completion of the chapter.

analyzed: iti pañcamaḥ adhyāyaḥ  /
translated: Thus ends the fifth chapter.

analyzed: ṣaṣṭhaḥ udhyāyaḥ
translated: Sixth Chapter
The Existence, Consciousness, and Bliss of All

analyzed: ṛbhuḥ
translated: Ribhu

original: sarvaṃ saccinmayaṃ viddhi sarvaṃ saccinmayaṃ tatam /
analyzed: sarvam sat cit mayam viddhi sarvam sat cit mayam tatam
translated: Know all to be of the nature of pure consciousness, and all to be pervaded by pure consciousness.

analyzed: saccidānandam advaitam saccidānandam avyayam  saccidānanda mātram hi saccidānandam anyakam
translated: The non-dual bliss of existence, consciousness, and bliss; the imperishable bliss of existence, consciousness, and bliss.🔽Existence, consciousness, and bliss alone; existence, consciousness, and bliss apart from other things.

analyzed: saccidānanda rūpa ūham saccidānandam eva kham
translated: I am of the form of existence, consciousness, and bliss; the space is existence, consciousness, and bliss alone.

analyzed: saccidānandam eva tvam saccidānandakaḥ asmi aham
translated: You are existence, consciousness, and bliss; I am full of existence, consciousness, and bliss.

original: p / yadyat svājñadṛṣṭivikalpitaṃ nāmarūpavikalpajālaṃ tattat svajñadṛṣṭyā saccidānandamayam / paramārthadṛṣṭyā brahmamātrātiriktaprasaktireva nāsti / yadi svājñādidṛṣṭyā asti nāstīti prasaktaṃ tadā tat asadeva / svātiriktāsadapahnavasiddhaṃ niṣpratiyogikabrahmamātramavaśiṣyate ityetatprapañcanāya ṣaṣṭhādhyāya ārabhyate ṛbhuriti // //
analyzed: yat yat sva ajña dṛṣṭi vikalpitam nāma rūpa vikalpa jālam tat tat svajña dṛṣṭyā saccidānanda mayam paramārtha dṛṣṭyā brahma mātra atirikta prasaktiḥ eva na asti yadi sva ajña ādi dṛṣṭyā asti na asti iti prasaktam tadā tat asat eva sva atirikta asat apahnava siddham niṣpratiyogika brahma mātram avaśiṣyate iti etad prapañcanāya ṣaṣṭha adhyāyaḥ ārabhyate ṛbhuḥ iti  /
translated: Whatever network of names and forms is imagined by the vision of one's ignorance, that is all of the nature of existence, consciousness, and bliss by the vision of one's knowledge. From the perspective of ultimate truth, there is no possibility of anything apart from Brahman alone. If it is possible to ask whether it exists or not from the perspective of one's ignorance etc., then that is indeed non-existent. What remains is Brahman alone, established by the denial of what is unreal apart from one's own self, and without any counter-correlate. This is elaborated in the sixth chapter, beginning with Ribhu.

analyzed: sarvasya brahmatvam
translated: The Brahman-hood of all

analyzed: na manaḥ buddhi ahaṃkāra citta saṃghātakāḥ amī
translated: These are not the conglomerations of mind, intellect, ego, and thoughts.

original: na tvaṃ nāhaṃ na cānyaṃ vā sarvaṃ brahmaiva kevalam /
analyzed: na tvam na aham na ca anyam vā sarvam brahma eva kevalam
translated: You are not, I am not, and there is no one else; all is Brahman alone.

analyzed: na vākyam na padam vā idam na akṣaram na jaḍam kvacid
translated: No sentence, no word, no Veda, no syllable, no dull matter anywhere.

original: na madhyaṃ nādi nāntaṃ vā na satyaṃ na nibandhanam /
analyzed: na madhyam na ādi na antam vā na satyam na nibandhanam
translated: No middle, no beginning, no end, no truth, no binding,

original: na duḥkhaṃ na sukhaṃ bhāvaṃ na mayā prakṛtistathā // //🔽na dehaṃ na mukhaṃ ghrāṇaṃ na jihvā na ca tālunī /
analyzed: na duḥkham na sukham bhāvam na mayā prakṛtiḥ tathā  na deham na mukham ghrāṇam na jihvā na ca tālunī
translated: No sorrow, no happiness, no state of being, no nature like mine.🔽No body, no face, no nose, no tongue, no palate,

analyzed: na danta uṣṭhau lalāṭam ca niśvāsa ucchvāsāḥ eva ca
translated: No teeth, lips, or forehead, no inhalation or exhalation.

original: na svedamasthi māṃsaṃ ca na raktaṃ na ca mūtrakam /
analyzed: na svedam asthi māṃsam ca na raktam na ca mūtrakam
translated: No sweat, no bones, no flesh, no blood, no urine,

original: na dūraṃ nāntikaṃ nāṅgaṃ nodaraṃ na kirīṭakam // //
analyzed: na dūram na antikam na aṅgam na udaram na kirīṭakam
translated: No far, no near, no limb, no belly, no crown.

original: na hastapādacalanaṃ na śāstraṃ na ca śāsanam /
analyzed: na hasta pāda calanam na śāstram na ca śāsanam
translated: No movement of hands and feet, no scripture, no teaching,

analyzed: na vettā vedanam vedyam na jāgrat svapna suptayaḥ
translated: No knower, no knowledge, no object of knowledge, no waking, dreaming, or sleeping.

original: turyātītaṃ na me kiṃcit sarvaṃ saccinmayaṃ tatam /🔽nādhyātmikaṃ nādhibhūtaṃ nādhidaivaṃ na māyikam // //
analyzed: turyātītam na me kiṃcid sarvam saccid mayam tatam  na ādhyātmikam na adhibhūtam na adhidaivam na māyikam
translated: Nothing beyond the fourth state for me, all is pervaded by the true, conscious Self.🔽Not pertaining to the individual self, not to beings, not to the overlord, not illusory,

analyzed: na viśvaḥ taijasaḥ prājñaḥ virāṭsūtra ātmaka īśvarāḥ
translated: Not the cosmic, the brilliant, the wise, the universal, the thread, the Self, or the Lord.

analyzed: na gama āgama ceṣṭā ca na naṣṭam na prayojanam
translated: No coming or going, no activity, nothing lost, no purpose.

analyzed: tyājyam grāhyam na dūṣyam vā hi amedhya amedhyakam tathā
translated: It should not be abandoned, accepted, criticized, impure or pure,

analyzed: na pīnam na kṛśam kledam na kālam deśa bhāṣaṇam
translated: not fat, not emaciated, not wet, not time, not speaking the local language,

analyzed: na sarvam na bhayam dvaitam na vṛkṣa tṛṇa parvatāḥ
translated: not everything, not fear, not duality, not trees, grass or mountains.

analyzed: na dhyānam yoga saṃsiddhiḥ na brahma kṣatra vaiśyakam  na pakṣī na mṛgaḥ na aṅgī na lobhaḥ mohaḥ eva ca
translated: Not meditation, not the attainment of yoga, not the duties of Brahmins, Kshatriyas or Vaishyas,🔽not a bird, not an animal, not an object, not greed, not delusion,

analyzed: na madaḥ na ca mātsaryam kāma krodha ādayaḥ tathā
translated: not pride, not envy, not desire, anger and so on,

original: na strīśūdraviḍālādi bhakṣyabhojyādikaṃ ca yat /🔽na prauḍhahīnau nāstikyaṃ na vārtāvasaro'sti hi // //
analyzed: na strī śūdra viḍāla ādi bhakṣya bhojya ādikam ca yat  na prauḍha hīnau nāstikyam na vārttā avasaraḥ asti hi
translated: not a woman, Shudra, cat or other such things, not what is to be eaten or enjoyed,🔽not advanced or inferior, not atheism, not the occasion for worldly pursuits,

original: na laukiko na loko vā na vyāpāro na mūḍhatā /
analyzed: na laukikaḥ na lokaḥ vā na vyāpāraḥ na mūḍha tā
translated: not worldly, not the world, not activity, not foolishness,

analyzed: na bhoktā bhojanam bhojyam na mātṛmān ameyakam
translated: not the enjoyer, not food, not what is to be eaten, not the mother, the measure, or the object to be measured,

original: na śatrumitraputrādirna mātā na pitā svasā /
analyzed: na śatru mitra putra ādiḥ na mātā na pitā svasā
translated: not enemies, friends, sons, etc., not a mother, not a father, not a sister,

analyzed: na janma na mṛtiḥ bṛddhiḥ na dehaḥ ūham iti bhramaḥ
translated: not birth, not death, not growth, not the delusion that the body is I,

analyzed: na śūnyam na api ca aśūnyam na antaḥkaraṇa saṃsṛtiḥ
translated: not empty, not non-empty, not the continuity of the internal organs,

analyzed: na rātriḥ na divā naktam na brahmā na hariḥ śivaḥ

analyzed: na vāra pakṣa māsādi vatsaram na ca cañcalam
translated: Not the month, fortnight, or year, nor fickle,

analyzed: na brahma lokaḥ vaikuṇṭham na kailāsaḥ na ca anyakaḥ
translated: Not the world of Brahma, Vaikuntha, Kailash, or any other,

analyzed: na svargam na ca deva indraḥ na agni lokaḥ na ca agnikaḥ

analyzed: na yamaḥ yama lokaḥ vā na lokāḥ loka pālakāḥ
translated: Not Yama, the world of Yama, nor the worlds of the guardians of the quarters,

analyzed: na bhūḥ bhuvaḥ svar trailokyam na pātālam na bhū talam
translated: Not the three worlds of earth, atmosphere, and heaven, not the nether world, nor the earth,

analyzed: na avidyā na ca vidyā ca na māyā prakṛtiḥ jaḍā
translated: Not ignorance, nor knowledge, nor Maya, nor the dull Prakriti,

analyzed: na sthiram kṣaṇikam nāśam na gatiḥ na ca dhāvanam
translated: Not stable, not momentary, not destruction, not motion, nor running,

analyzed: na dhyātavyam na me snānam na mantraḥ na japaḥ kvacid
translated: Not to be meditated upon, not my bath, not mantra, not japa anywhere,

original: na padārthaṃ na pūjārhaṃ nābhiṣekaṃ na cārcanam /
analyzed: na padārtham na pūjā arham na abhiṣekam na ca arcanam
translated: Not an object, not worthy of worship, not consecration, not adoration,

analyzed: na puṣpam na phalam patram gandha puṣpa ādi dhūpakam

translated: Not supplication, not separate existence, not oblation, not saluting the fire,

analyzed: na homaḥ na ca karmāṇi na durvākyam subhāṣaṇam
translated: Not oblation, not rites, not bad speech, not good speech,

translated: There is no Gayatri, no conjunction, no mind, no bad position,🔽No bad hope, no evil-minded, no Chandala, no Pulkasa.

analyzed: na duḥsaham durālāpam na kirātaḥ na kaitavam
translated: Not unbearable, not bad talk, not a Kirata, not a cheat.

translated: Not a lineage, not a family, not a thread, not omnipotence, not emptiness.

analyzed: na strī na yoṣit naḥ vṛddhā na kanyā na

original: brahmaivāhaṃ na ca prāṇo brahmaivāhaṃ parātparaḥ // //
analyzed: brahma eva aham na ca prāṇaḥ brahma eva aham parātparaḥ
translated: I am Brahman alone, not the life-force. I am Brahman alone, greater than the greatest.

original: idam brahma paraṃ brahma satyaṃ brahma prabhurhi saḥ /
analyzed: idam brahma param brahma satyam brahma prabhuḥ hi saḥ
translated: This is Brahman, the supreme Brahman. Brahman is the truth, for He is the Lord.

original: kālo brahma kalā brahma sukhaṃ brahma svayaṃprabham // //
analyzed: kālaḥ brahma kalā brahma sukham brahma svayaṃprabham
translated: Time is Brahman, the digit is Brahman, happiness is Brahman, the self-luminous one.

original: ekaṃ brahma dvayaṃ brahma moho brahma śamādikam /
analyzed: ekam brahma dvayam brahma mohaḥ brahma śama ādikam
translated: Brahman is one, Brahman is two, delusion is Brahman, tranquility etc. are Brahman.

original: doṣo brahma guṇo brahma damaḥ śāntaṃ vibhuḥ prabhuḥ // //
analyzed: doṣaḥ brahma guṇaḥ brahma damaḥ śāntam vibhuḥ prabhuḥ
translated: Defilement is Brahman, virtue is Brahman, self-control, peace, the all-pervading Lord.

original: loko brahma gururbrahma śiṣyo brahma sadāśivaḥ /
analyzed: lokaḥ brahma guruḥ brahma śiṣyaḥ brahma sadāśivaḥ
translated: The world is Brahman, the teacher is Brahman, the disciple is Brahman, Sadasiva is Brahman.

original: pūrvaṃ brahma paraṃ brahma śuddhaṃ brahma śubhāśubham // //
analyzed: pūrvam brahma param brahma śuddham brahma śubha aśubham
translated: The supreme Brahman, the pure Brahman, the auspicious and inauspicious Brahman,

analyzed: jīvaḥ eva sadā brahma saccidānandam asmi aham
translated: The individual soul is always Brahman, I am existence, consciousness, and bliss.

original: sarvaṃ brahmamayaṃ proktaṃ sarvaṃ brahmamayaṃ jagat // //
analyzed: sarvam brahma mayam proktam sarvam brahma mayam jagat
translated: Everything is said to be Brahman, the entire universe is Brahman.

original: svayaṃ brahma na saṃdehaḥ svasmādanyanna kiṃcana /
analyzed: svayam brahma na saṃdehaḥ svasmāt anyat na kiṃcana
translated: One is oneself Brahman, there is no doubt, there is nothing else but one's own self.

analyzed: sarvam ātmā eva śuddha ātmā sarvam cit mātram advayam
translated: Everything is the pure self, everything is the non-dual pure consciousness.

original: nityanirmalarūpātmā hyātmano'nyanna kiṃcana /🔽saccidānandabrahmātirekeṇa na mana ityādi // // na manobuddhyahaṃkāra ityārabhya aṇimādivibhūtayaḥ ityantaṃ yadyat
analyzed: nitya nirmala rūpa ātmā hi ātmanaḥ nyat na kiṃcana  saccidānanda brahma atirekeṇa na manaḥ ityādi na manaḥ buddhi ahaṃkāraḥ iti ārabhya aṇima ādi vibhūtayaḥ iti antam yat yat
translated: The self has a form that is eternally pure, there is nothing else but the self.🔽Except for Brahman, which is existence, consciousness, and bliss, there is no mind, etc.

original: p / svājñadṛṣṭyāropitaṃ svajñadṛṣṭyā brahmātiriktaṃ netyapoditaṃ ca tattat sarvamityādi // //
analyzed: sva ajña dṛṣṭyā āropitam sva jña dṛṣṭyā brahma atiriktam na iti apoditam ca tat tat sarvam ityādi  /
translated: From There is no mind, intellect, ego up to the powers such as the ability to become atomic, whatever is superimposed by one's ignorant vision and denied by one's enlightened vision as being different from Brahman, all that and more is referred to by all that and so on.

analyzed: aṇu mātra lasat rūpam aṇu mātram idam jagat  aṇu mātram śarīram vā hi aṇu mātram asatyakam
translated: The self-identity of Brahman, which is free from any counter-correlate🔽This universe, which shines with a form as small as an atom, is as small as an atom.🔽Whether the body is as small as an atom or as small as an atom of untruth,

analyzed: aṇu mātram acintyam vā cintyam vā hi aṇu mātrakam
translated: Whether it is inconceivable or conceivable, it is as small as an atom.

analyzed: brahmā eva sarvam cit mātram brahma mātram jagattrayam
translated: Brahman alone is all, mere consciousness; the three worlds are mere Brahman.

analyzed: ānandam paramānandam anyat kiṃcid na kiṃcana
translated: Bliss, supreme bliss; nothing else, nothing at all.

analyzed: caitanya mātram oṃkāram brahmā eva sakalam svayam
translated: Pure consciousness is Om; Brahman alone is the whole, by itself.

analyzed: aham eva jagat sarvam aham eva param padam
translated: I alone am the entire world; I alone am the supreme state.

analyzed: aham eva guṇa atītaḥ aham eva parātparaḥ
translated: I alone am beyond the qualities; I alone am higher than the highest.

analyzed: aham eva param brahma aham eva guroḥ guruḥ
translated: I alone am the supreme Brahman; I alone am the guru of the gurus.

analyzed: aham eva akhila ādhāra aham eva sukhāt sukham
translated: I alone am the support of all; I alone am happiness within happiness.

analyzed: ātmanaḥ anyat jagat na asti ātmanaḥ anyat sukham na ca
translated: There is no world other than the Self; there is no happiness other than the Self.

analyzed: ātmanaḥ anyā gatiḥ nā asti sarvam ātma mayam jagat
translated: There is no goal other than the Self; the entire world is full of the Self.

original: ātmano'nyannahi kvāpi ātmano'nyat tṛṇaṃ na hi // //
analyzed: ātmanaḥ anyat nahi kvāpi ātmanaḥ anyat tṛṇam na hi
translated: There is nothing anywhere else than the Self; there is no straw other than the Self.

analyzed: ātmanaḥ anyat tuṣam na asti sarvam ātmayam jagat
translated: There is no husk other than the Self; the entire world is full of the Self.

analyzed: brahma mātram idam sarvam brahma mātram asat na hi
translated: This entire universe is Brahman alone; Brahman alone is not existent.

original: brahmamātraṃ śrutaṃ sarvaṃ svayaṃ brahmaiva kevalam /
analyzed: brahma mātram śrutam sarvam svayam brahma eva kevalam
translated: Everything is heard as Brahman alone; one is Brahman alone.

original: brahmamātraṃ vṛtaṃ sarvaṃ brahmamātraṃ rasaṃ sukham // //
analyzed: brahma mātram vṛtam sarvam brahma mātram rasam sukham
translated: Everything is enveloped by Brahman alone; Brahman alone is the essence of bliss.

analyzed: brahma mātram cit ākāśam saccidānandam advayam
translated: The Brahman is the mere consciousness-space, existence, consciousness, bliss, and non-dual.

analyzed: brahmaṇaḥ anyatarat na asti brahmaṇaḥ anyat jagat na ca
translated: There is nothing other than Brahman, and the world is not different from Brahman.

original: brahmaṇo'nyadahaṃ nāsti brahmaṇo'nyat phalaṃ na hi /🔽brahmaṇo'nyattṛṇaṃ nāsti brahmaṇo'nyat padaṃ na hi // //
analyzed: brahmaṇaḥ anyat aham na asti brahmaṇaḥ anyat phalam na hi  brahmaṇaḥ anyat tṛṇam na asti brahmaṇaḥ anyat padam na hi
translated: I am not other than Brahman, and there is no fruit other than Brahman.🔽There is no grass other than Brahman, and there is no place other than Brahman.

original: brahmaṇo'nyadgururnāsti brahmaṇo'nyadasadvapuḥ /🔽brahmaṇo'nyanna cāhaṃtā tvattedante na hi kvacit // //
analyzed: brahmaṇaḥ anyat guruḥ na asti brahmaṇaḥ anyat asat vapuḥ  brahmaṇā unyat na ca ahaṃtā tvattā idante na hi kvacid
translated: There is no guru other than Brahman, and there is no unreal body other than Brahman.🔽There is no sense of 'I' other than Brahman, and there is no sense of 'you' or 'that' anywhere.

analyzed: svayam brahma ātmakam viddhi svasmāt anyat na kiṃcana
translated: Know that everything is Brahman by nature, and there is nothing else apart from it.

analyzed: yat kiṃcid dṛśyate loke yat kiṃcid bhāṣyate janaiḥ
translated: Whatever is seen in the world, whatever is spoken by people,

original: yatkiṃcid bhujyate kvāpi tat sarvamasadeva hi /
analyzed: yat kiṃcid bhujyate kvāpi tat sarvam asat eva hi
translated: Whatever is enjoyed anywhere, all that is indeed unreal.

analyzed: kartṛ bhedam kriyā bhedam guṇa bhedam rasa ādikam
translated: The difference in agents, the difference in actions, the difference in qualities like taste,

analyzed: liṅga bhedam idam sarvam asat eva sadā sukham
translated: This entire difference in gender is always unreal and blissful.

analyzed: kāla bhedam deśa bhedam vastu bhedam jaya ajayam
translated: The difference in time, the difference in place, the difference in objects, victory and defeat,

original: yadyadbhedaṃ ca tat sarvamasadeva hi kevalam /
analyzed: yat yat bhedam ca tat sarvam asat eva hi kevalam
translated: Whatever is different, all that is only unreal.

analyzed: asat antaḥkaraṇakam asat eva indriya ādikam
translated: The internal organ is unreal, the senses etc. are indeed unreal,

analyzed: asat prāṇa ādikam sarvam saṃghātam asat ātmakam
translated: All that is insubstantial, such as life force and so on, is a collection of what is essentially unreal.

analyzed: asatyam pañca kośa ākhyam asatyam pañca devatāḥ  asatyam saṣ vikāra ādi asatyam arivargakam
translated: The five sheaths are false, the five deities are false,🔽The six transformations and so on are false, the group of enemies is false,

translated: The six seasons are false, and likewise the six tastes are false.🔽I am mere existence, consciousness, and bliss; this world is unborn.

analyzed: ātmā eva aham param satyam na anyāḥ saṃsāra dṛṣṭayaḥ
translated: I am the Self, the supreme truth; other worldly views are false.

analyzed: satyam ānanda rūpā uham cidghana ānanda vigrahaḥ
translated: I am true, of the nature of bliss, my form is the bliss of the dense consciousness.

analyzed: aham eva parānandaḥ aham eva parātparaḥ
translated: I alone am the supreme bliss, I alone am higher than the highest.

analyzed: jñāna ākāram idam sarvam jñāna ānandaḥ ūham advayaḥ
translated: This entire universe is of the form of knowledge; I am the bliss of knowledge, non-dual.

analyzed: sarva prakāśa rūpa ūham sarva abhāva svarūpakaḥ
translated: I am of the form of all light, of the nature of all absence.

analyzed: aham eva sadā bhāmi iti evaṃrūpam kutas api asat
translated: How can there be such a form as I always exist?

analyzed: tvam iti evam param brahma cit maya ānanda rūpavān
translated: Thus, the supreme Brahman is of the nature of consciousness and bliss.

analyzed: cit ākāram cit ākāśam cit eva paramam sukham
translated: Consciousness is the form, the space of consciousness, consciousness alone is the supreme bliss.

analyzed: ātmā eva aham asan na aham kūṭasthaḥ uham guruḥ paraḥ
translated: I am the Self, I am non-existent, I am the unchanging, I am the supreme Guru.

analyzed: saccidānanda mātra ūham anutpannam idam jagat
translated: I am mere existence, consciousness, and bliss; this world is unborn.

analyzed: kālam nā asti jagat nā asti māyā prakṛtiḥ eva na
translated: There is no time, no world, only the primordial nature of illusion.

analyzed: aham eva hariḥ sākṣāt aham eva sadāśivaḥ
translated: I am Hari himself, I am Sadashiva himself.

analyzed: śuddha caitanya bhāvaḥ aham śuddha sattva anubhāvanaḥ
translated: I am the essence of pure consciousness, the manifestation of pure sattva.

analyzed: advaya ānanda mātrā ūham cidghana eka rasaḥ asmi aham
translated: I am the bliss of non-duality alone, I am the essence of pure consciousness.

analyzed: sarvam brahma eva satatam sarvam brahma eva kevalam
translated: Everything is Brahman alone, always, everything is Brahman alone, the pure.

original: sarvaṃ brahmaiva satataṃ sarvaṃ brahmaiva cetanam /
analyzed: sarvam brahma eva satatam sarvam brahma eva cetanam
translated: Everything is Brahman alone, always, everything is Brahman alone, the conscious.

analyzed: sarva antaryāmi rūpa ūham sarva sākṣi tva lakṣaṇaḥ
translated: I am in the form of the immanent soul of all, characterized by being the witness of all.

analyzed: parama ātmā param jyotiḥ param dhāma parā gatiḥ
translated: I am the supreme Self, the supreme light, the supreme abode, the supreme goal.

translated: I am the essence of all Vedanta, ascertained by all scriptures.
I am the form of the bliss of yoga, the great rise of the bliss of the principal.

translated: I am the light of all knowledge, the embodiment of the principal knowledge.

analyzed: cit akṣaraḥ ūham satya ūham
translated: I am the imperishable consciousness, I am the truth, I am Vasudeva, the deathless, the immortal.

original: ahaṃ brahma cidākāśaṃ nityaṃ brahma nirañjanam /
analyzed: aham brahma cit ākāśam nityam brahma nirañjanam
translated: I am Brahman, the sky of consciousness, the eternal Brahman, the stainless.

analyzed: śuddham buddham sadāmuktam anāmakam arūpakam
translated: Pure, enlightened, always liberated, nameless, formless.

analyzed: saccidānanda rūpa ūham anutpannam idam jagat
translated: I am of the nature of existence, consciousness, and bliss. This world is unborn.

analyzed: satya asatyam jagat na asti saṃkalpa kalanā ādikam
translated: The world, whether real or unreal, does not exist. Imagination and conceptualization, etc. are not real.

analyzed: nitya ānanda mayam brahma kevalam sarvadā svayam
translated: Brahman is eternal bliss, solely existent, always self-existent.

analyzed: anantam avyayam śāntam eka rūpam anāmayam
translated: Infinite, imperishable, peaceful, of one form, free from disease.🔽The limited nature of the world, which is imagined by the vision of one's own ignorance, other than Brahman, and the emptiness of Brahman, the substratum of that, from the three kinds of limitations, and the denial of any general entity other than Brahman in reality, and the non-existence of any counter-correlate of Brahman, which is solely one's own self, are stated by even an atom etc.🔽The world is established by the denial of the unreal proliferation imagined by one's own ignorance. translated: If there is any fear in the words of a barren woman's son,

translated: If the world is satisfied by drinking the water of a mirage, then this world exists.

analyzed: nara śṛṅgeṇa naṣṭaḥ ced kaścid astu idam eva hi
translated: If someone perishes due to the horn of a man, then this alone exists.

translated: If the city of Gandharvas is true, the world always exists.🔽If there is truth in the blueness of the sky, the world will be true.

original: śuktikārajataṃ satyaṃ bhūṣaṇaṃ cejjagadbhavet // //🔽rajjusarpeṇa daṣṭaścennaro bhavatu saṃsṛtiḥ /

translated: If the silver in a mother-of-pearl shell is true, the world would be an ornament.🔽If a man is bitten by the snake in a rope, let there be worldly existence.

translated: If the world is destroyed by the arrow of gold in the flaming fire,

translated: If darkness is destroyed by lamps in a picture, let this world exist.

translated: From I will sleep in my own nature up to he is called a living liberated one, he reveals the fruit of living liberation that occurs in between the knowledge of Brahman without distinctions. Beginning with Having become Brahman, with a tranquil self, up to Rejoice in your own self, Vaidehi, attain liberation, he reveals the primary fruit of the knowledge of Brahman alone, which is the liberation of the embodied one characterized by abiding in that alone. Then, taking up another narrative, beginning with Brahman is the end of all speech and so on, he teaches the true nature of one's own self. Beginning with Or the occurrence of 'not-self' and so on, he teaches the true nature of the not-self. Having loosened the connection between the two by the statement self and not-self, the possibility of oneness and difference between the two, by dependent Vedic statements and reasonings such as In the absence of one, the second is not, in some places, he establishes the nature of one's own self alone as a relation without an opposite, by the difference in words and meaning between the self and the not-self that are different from one's own self, and the non-existence of this world and so on of a general that is different from one's own self.
